job_posting.title: PHP/Drupal Web Developer at the New York State Senate
job_posting.summary: You will be joining a small group of developers who, from the bottom up, have designed and implemented a number of core services on top of proven open source technologies. These services offer robust user interfaces as well as open, RESTful APIs that are built using Java and PHP, and utilize several open source applications such as: Apache, PHP, Drupal, CiviCRM, MySQL, Tomcat, Maven, Elasticsearch, PostgreSQL, and Memcached. The ideal candidate will be an exceptionally competent programmer, with experience developing large, complex applications in an enterprise environment, an acute attention to detail, and the ability to self manage. In short, the candidate should be highly motivated to produce superior work.

required: Design, code, test, and deploy new and enhanced web applications and services, including the Senate’s CRM (Constituent Relationship Management) and both the public website (NYSenate.gov) and internal intranet site (MySenate), which are both Drupal projects.
Work both independently and as part of a collaborative team of technologists.
Engage with non-technical end users to understand and define business requirements.
Participate in a dynamic dev environment, moving adeptly between concurrent PHP projects.
Develop high-quality, reusable components using version control.
Design applications, APIs, and user interfaces, with an emphasis on usability.
Write technical specifications, context diagrams, and/or design documents.
Evaluate and use new technologies, frameworks, and libraries for production systems
useful_experience: A degree in Computer Science and two years of programming experience in an enterprise environment, or equivalent technical expertise.
React, Next.js, Angular, Vue, and/or jQuery.
Mobile app development (both platform and web-based) and responsive web design.
ideal_experience: PHP, Drupal, and/or CiviCRM and associated IDEs such as PHPStorm or Eclipse.
Linux environments, including the Bourne-Again SHell.
Version Control Systems such as Git and Github.
PHP documentation generators such as phpDocumentor, phpDox, and Doxygen.
